questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.feedback: HTML stands for Hypertext Markup Language and is used to create the structure of web pages.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define the most important heading?
questions.feedback: The <h1> tag is used to define the most important heading, with <h6> being the least important.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to create a hyperlink?
questions.feedback: The <a> tag is used to create hyperlinks in HTML. The href attribute specifies the URL of the page the link goes to.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the attribute in an tag?
options: To specify the width of the image
To provide alternate text for an image if it cannot be displayed
To specify the alignment of the image
To provide a link to the image
questions.feedback: The <alt> attribute provides alternate text for an image, which is important for accessibility and in cases where the image cannot be displayed.

questions.question: Which tag is used to define a paragraph in HTML?
questions.feedback:
The

tag is used to define paragraphs in HTML.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid HTML tag?
questions.feedback: The <container> tag is not a valid HTML tag. The other options are valid tags used in HTML.

questions.question: How do you create an unordered list in HTML?
questions.feedback: The <ul> tag is used to create an unordered list, with each list item defined by the <li> tag.

questions.question: Which attribute is used to open a hyperlink in a new tab or window?
questions.feedback: The 'target="_blank"' attribute is used to open a hyperlink in a new tab or window.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define an internal style sheet?
questions.feedback: The <style> tag is used to define internal styles within an HTML document.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to specify a footer for a document or section?
questions.feedback: The <footer> element is used to specify a footer for a document or a section within a document.

questions.question: Which of the following tags is used to create a table in HTML?
questions.feedback: All of the options are part of creating a table in HTML: <table> defines the table, <tr> defines a row, and <td> defines a cell.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <meta> tag in HTML?
options: To include metadata about the HTML document
To link to an external CSS file
questions.feedback: The <meta> tag is used to include metadata about the HTML document, such as the character set, author, and description.

questions.question: Which tag is used to create a drop-down list in HTML?
questions.feedback: The <select> tag is used to create a drop-down list in HTML.

questions.question: What does the <em> tag do to the enclosed text?
questions.feedback: The <em> tag emphasizes the text and displays it in italic by default.
